update.description:
Issue #37

This is the implementation of generate track mean for supervision label based on track data only in supervision region instead of the whole track.
I am not sure whether it should be permanent feature or my hacky approach but I'll setup the Issue & pull request first.

Now there is a new parameter added to the main segway function: ```--set-supervision-mean```.
If set, the base mean for all track for each label with semi-supervision present will be the mean of the track data in the supervision region. The real mean will be still added by std * rand(-0.2, 0.2) because I want to still keep some randomness. The std here is still generate by the whole track and there the reason why I did not change it is stated below.

I did not generate a Gaussian variance only from the supervision region. I do think it is useful to add that feature but the current the variance seems to be uniform at first for all label, generating it in different way seems to require changing the structure of input-master file which I don't have time to do. Also if this would be a permanent feature then there is a problem we have to consider if we do it this way: what if we only have a very small supervision region? Variance could be 0. 

If not set, everything is the same.

Some other important issue of this modification:
1. It does not support subseg
2. It does not support Trackgroup

I am not sure how the behaviour should be defined when subseg and Trackgroup is used.
update.title: Semisupervised Mean Generate from Track data in supervision region.

content.raw: This will be put on hold for now. It's not a high priority since changing altering the initial gaussian means do not *seem* to have a significant effect on results. This may be revisited in the future however.
content.html: This will be put on hold for now. It's not a high priority since changing altering the initial gaussian means do not seem to have a significant effect on results. This may be revisited in the future however.

content.raw:
There is a bug inside this code when I specify the track using --track parameter. I will find out way to fix that.

Update: Fixed in commits 
https://bitbucket.org/Tamaki_Sakura/segway/commits/701a4b779309b48c45cfe5dbbf39139016406709
content.html:
There is a bug inside this code when I specify the track using --track parameter. I will find out way to fix that.

Update: Fixed in commits https://bitbucket.org/Tamaki_Sakura/segway/commits/701a4b779309b48c45cfe5dbbf39139016406709

content.raw:
Personally I believe it would preferable if you split this into a feature request along with the pull request. Aftewards link the feature request from the pull request and vice-versa.

Afterwards we can distinctly separate the discussion between the feature, and the specific code/changes placed in the pull request.

I have a number of comments on both topics but I'd rather address them individually. Also specifically I'd like to discuss the feature itself before discussing the code changes in this pull request.
content.html:
Personally I believe it would preferable if you split this into a feature request along with the pull request. Aftewards link the feature request from the pull request and vice-versa.

Afterwards we can distinctly separate the discussion between the feature, and the specific code/changes placed in the pull request.

I have a number of comments on both topics but I'd rather address them individually. Also specifically I'd like to discuss the feature itself before discussing the code changes in this pull request.

I am not sure whether it should be permanent feature or my hacky approach but I'll setup the pull request first.

Now there is a new parameter added to the main segway function: ```--set-supervision-mean```.
If set, the base mean for all track for each label with semi-supervision present will be the mean of the track data in the supervision region. The real mean will be still added by std * rand(-0.2, 0.2) because I want to still keep some randomness. The std here is still generate by the whole track and there the reason why I did not change it is stated below.

I did not generate a Gaussian variance only from the supervision region. I do think it is useful to add that feature but the current the variance seems to be uniform at first for all label, generating it in different way seems to require changing the structure of input-master file which I don't have time to do. I am not sure how the behaviour should be defined when subseg and Trackgroup is used.
